benchmark_details.name: MotionBench
benchmark_details.overview: MotionBench is a comprehensive evaluation benchmark designed to assess the fine-grained motion comprehension of video understanding models through six primary categories of motion-oriented question types.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To thoroughly evaluate the motion-level capability of current video models and motivate the development of more capable video understanding models.

data.source: Diverse video sources including web videos, movies, and synthetic videos from various datasets.
data.annotation: Manually annotated with distinct question types focused on fine-grained motion.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy calculated based on the percentage of correctly answered questions.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better motion-level comprehension capabilities.
methodology.baseline_results: State-of-the-art models achieve less than 60% accuracy on MotionBench.
methodology.validation: Evaluated on various existing video benchmarks.
